posts.author: BraxxWarborn
posts.content: I am new to playing a cleric so I apologize before hand if this is a foolish question. I started my build as a paladin and at second level I swapped to cleric. posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Right-click the slot on the bottom of the screen where you want your domain power, select special abilities (straight to the left), then select Cleric, then your domain power. That will assign the domain power to that slot.

posts.author: BraxxWarborn
posts.content:
The problem is I am not seeing Cleric powers even show up when I do this. If I start a fresh Cleric character the game defaults my domain powers into the hotbar cells. That said if I choose to move the powers to a different cell I am unable to do so as they do not show up in the radial menu. Is it possible my game is broken or am I just a little slow here? Thanks for any advice guys.


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you want to remove anything from a quick-slot, right-click on the slot and select the * at the bottom.
If you have difficulties adding something new, try to empty the slot first.
You can add things to the quick slots by right-clicking the way empyre told you, but you can also add items and spells by dragging them to the slot.

posts.content:
